metadata.title: CVE-2016-5611 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Unspecified vulnerability in the Oracle VM VirtualBox component before5.0.28 and 5.1.x before 5.1.8 in Oracle Virtualization allows local usersto affect confidentiality via vectors related to Core.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5611` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

virtualbox - 5.1.8
virtualbox-dkms - 5.1.8
virtualbox-guest-dkms - 5.1.8
virtualbox-guest-source - 5.1.8
virtualbox-guest-utils - 5.1.8
virtualbox-guest-x11 - 5.1.8
virtualbox-qt - 5.1.8
virtualbox-source - 5.1.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: virtualbox package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.1.8').
